page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY OF CHURCH
page.content: On the site of the kirk at Inveresk about 3,000 years ago there was a Druid sacrificial temple. Roman relics have been found in the area around the kirk and graveyard. By using aerial photographs, archaeologists have shown that there was a triple line of defensive ditches. Christianity was first brought to Musselburgh by an Irish woman called Modwenna about 500 ad. Since that time two stone churches have been built on the same site. The Reverend Adamson is the 18th minister of Inveresk Kirk since 1562. The church has some beautiful features eg the Strachan stained glass window, the communion table (it is thought to be from Antwerp) dates from the 1700's and shows the Last Supper in magnificent carving.
